en: A friendly beta-tester who says they teach grammar attempts to gently point out some problems you have with the text on your website: there are typos everywhere.
It admittedly does look somewhat unprofessional, but you're not sure you have the time or the grammatical knowledge to fix it. Hire a proofreader for $300?
You hire the proofreader. It costs a chunk, but it's worth it for the peace of mind and added touch of professionalism. They also make home helpful re-wording suggestions.
A proofreader isn't worth the money. You spend the next few days combing for errors, hoping it doesn't look as unprofessional as the beta-tester says.
